action.action-desc: Mr. Moore of North Carolina (for himself, Mr. Davis of North Carolina, Mr. Van Orden, Mr. McGuire, Mr. Edwards, Mr. Aderholt, Mr. Norman, Mr. Bergman, Mr. Ciscomani, Mr. Hamadeh of Arizona, Mr. Barrett, and Mr. Rogers of Kentucky) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To authorize the issuance of a Border Operations Service Medal to servicemembers and Federal personnel who served in designated border operations between January 1, 2025, and the conclusions of such operations, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Border Operations Service Medal Act.

paragraph.text: The President, by Executive Order in January 2025, authorized national security operations along the United States-Mexico border.
Servicemembers and Federal personnel participated in extensive security, humanitarian, and enforcement efforts.
Recognizing their contributions with a distinct service medal is essential for honoring their dedication and commitment.

subsection.text: To reflect service and commitment during designated border security operations between January 1, 2025, and the conclusions of such operations, the Secretary of Defense, in consultation with the heads of military service branches, shall design and issue a Border Operations Service Medal (in this section referred to as the Medal) toâ€”

paragraph.text: active-duty members of the Armed Forces, and
members of the National Guard and Reserve,

subsection.text: The Medal shall be authorized for wear according to military uniform regulations and Federal service recognition guidelines.
Not later than 60 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Defense shall issue regulations to carry out this section.
